NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
HospitalDischargeReport 0..*BaseA - Hospital Discharge Report (eHN)
header 1..1HeaderA.1 - Hospital Discharge Report header data element
body 1..1BaseA.2 - Hospital Discharge Report body data element
presentedForm 0..1BaseA.2.0 - Hospital Discharge Report in its narrative form
advanceDirectives 0..1AdvanceDirectivesA.2.1 - Advance directives
alerts 0..1AlertsA.2.2 - Alerts

Documentation for this format

name: HospitalDischargeReportEhn
title: A - Hospital Discharge Report (eHN)
copyright: Used by permission of HL7 Europe, all rights reserved Creative Commons License

element.definition: Hospital Discharge Report

element.short: A.1 - Hospital Discharge Report header data element
element.definition: Hospital Discharge Report header data element

element.short: A.2 - Hospital Discharge Report body data element
element.definition: Hospital Discharge Report body data element

element.short: A.2.0 - Hospital Discharge Report in its narrative form
element.definition: Hospital Discharge Report in its narrative form
Advance directives
Alerts
Encounter
Admission evaluation - Admission status should be reported exceptionally only if it is relevant to ensure continuity of care.
Patient history (might include information about provenance of the information)
Course of hospitalisation (Hospital stay)
Discharge details (structured information should be provided, however if not available, at least a summary note should be present).
Objective findings

Functional status can be assessed in several different ways, usually with a focus on the persona's abilities to perform basic activities of daily living (ADL), which include basic self-care such as bathing, feeding, and toileting and instrumental activities of daily living (IADL), which includes activities such as cooking, shopping, and managing one's own affairs.
For details see: https://paciowg.github.io/functional-status-ig/
Discharge summary note

element.short: A.2.8 - Care plan and other recommendations after discharge.
element.definition: Care plan and other recommendations after discharge.
Care plan after discharge. Multiple care plans could be provided.

Summary information on the medication recommended for the period after discharge, indicating whether the medication is changed or newly started. Compared to previous practices, the overview is supplemented with medication that has been discontinued.

Other recommendations (advice) after discharge. Multiple recommendations could be provided. E.g., recommendation to suggest hip replacement, reduce number of cigarettes, stop smoking, increase physical exercises, etc.
